tuv.seg: Checklist when appealing a social welfare decision
Seicliosta nuair atá achomharc á dhéanamh in aghaidh chinnidh leasa shóisialaigh
Appealing a social welfare decision
Má tá tú míshásta le cinneadh a rinne an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí faoi íocaíocht, tá sé de rogha agat achomharc a dhéanamh in aghaidh an chinnidh sin
If you are unhappy with a decision of the Department of Social Protection you can make an appeal
Sula ndéanann tú achomharc, ní mór socrú an féidir achomharc a dhéanamh i gcoinne an chinnidh agus cé leis a ndéanfaidh tú an t-achomharc
Depending on the type of payment, you appeal either to the Social Welfare Appeals Office or the Department of Social Protection
Déanfar an t-achomharc chuig Oifig Achomhairc Leasa Shóisialaigh nó leis an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí, braitheann sé ar an gcineál íocaíochta
There are a number of stages involved in the appeal process
Tá céimeanna éagsúla sa nós imeachta achomhairc
This checklist outlines these stages and explains the process involved in making an appeal to the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Cuireann an seicliosta seo na céimeanna seo in iúl agus míníonn sé próiseas an achomhairc
Is the payment or scheme you wish to appeal covered by the Social Welfare Appeals Office?
An féidir an t-achomharc a dhéanamh leis an Oifig Achomhairc Leasa Shóisialaigh?
Most social welfare schemes are covered by the Social Welfare Appeals Office (pdf)
Léirítear na scéimeanna leasa shóisialaigh gur féidir achomharc foirmeálta a dhéanamh ina n-aghaidh (pdf)

If the payment or scheme you wish to appeal is not covered by the Social Welfare Appeals Office, you can ask for a review of the decision by the Department of Social Protection but you cannot bring it to a formal appeal

Mura bhfuil an íocaíocht nó an scéim gur mhaith leat achomharc a dhéanamh uirthi clúdaithe ag an Oifig Achomhairc, tá sé de rogha agat iarraidh go ndéanfadh an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí an cinneadh a athbhreithniú, ach ní féidir achomharc foirmeálta a dhéanamh
Are you within the time limits for making an appeal?
An bhfuil tú laistigh den teorainn ama chun achomharc a dhéanamh?
Generally you have 21 days following the decision to get your appeal into the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Go hiondúil, ní mór achomharc a dhéanamh leis an Oifig Achomhairc laistigh de 21 lá ó rinneadh an cinneadh
If your application is late, you must give the reasons why it is late
Má tá d'iarratas déanach, ní foláir duit cúiseanna na moille sin a léiriú
Appeals Officers do not have to accept late applications
Níl dualgas ar na hOifigigh Achomhairc glacadh le hiarratais dhéanacha
Do you need help with making your appeal?
An bhfuil cabhair uait chun an t-achomharc a dhéanamh?
Some voluntary organisations (such as your local Citizens Information Centre) can help you to decide if you have grounds for an appeal
Tá roinnt eagraíochtaí deonacha ann (ar nós an tIonad Faisnéise do Shaoránaigh áitiúil) agus is féidir leo treoir a thabhairt duit le socrú an bhfuil foras achomhairc agat
They can help you to prepare your case and may even go with you on the day of your oral hearing
Is féidir leo do chás a ullmhú leat agus féadfaidh siad dul mar ionadaí leat ar lá d'éisteachta
Why you do not agree with the Department of Social Protection's decision?
Cén fáth nach raibh tú sásta le cinneadh na Roinne? Leag amach na cúiseanna cén fáth
Set out why you do not agree with the Department's decision
An bhfuil do cháipéisí ar fad agat chun do chás a chruthú?
All your documents on the appeal file should be arranged in date order
Ba chóir cáipéisí sa chomhad achomhairc a eagrú de réir dátaí
You may find it useful to read some examples of cases taken to the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Sa chás nach bhfuil ach fótachóipeanna le fáil, ba chóir iad a bheith d'ardchaighdeán agus soléite
Put in your 'Notice of Appeal (pdf)' with the information you have gathered before the 21 day deadline
Cuir an fhoirm "Cuir isteach d'Fhógra Achomhairc" faoi bhráid na hOifige Achomharc leis an bhfaisnéis atá bailithe agat roimh an spriocdháta 21 lá
Remember, the Notice of Appeal should contain:
Cuimhnigh, ba chóir an t-eolas seo a leanas a bheith san fhógra achomhairc:
• Your name and address
D'ainm agus do sheoladh
• Your Personal Public Service Number
• D'Uimhir Phearsanta Seirbhíse Poiblí
• The decision you are appealing
• An cinneadh a bhfuil achomharc á dhéanamh agat ina aghaidh
• Write down all the facts and points that support why you believe the Departments's decision was wrong
• Ráiteas leis na fíricí agus pointí a bheidh á n-úsáid agat san achomharc
You should also add any documentary evidence you have, for example, copies of letters from the Department, your doctor or social worker
Ba chóir fianaise fhaisnéiseach chun tacú le do chás a chur faoi bhráid na hOifige Achomharc leis an bhFógra Achomhairc
(If you need help with this or any part of your appeal contact your local Citizens Information Centre.)
• Ba cheart cóip den litir ón Roinn chuig an Oifigeach Cinnidh maidir leis an achomharc a bheith sa litir chomh maith
Has the Social Welfare Appeals Office confirmed in writing they got your appeal?
Ar dhearbhaigh an Oifig Achomhairc i scríbhinn go bhfuair siad d'achomharc?
It will contain your Appeal Reference Number
Beidh d'Uimhir Tagartha Achomhairc leis an dearbhú
You should put your Appeal Reference Number on all written communication with the Social Welfare Appeals Office
Ba chóir an uimhir seo a thabhairt i gcumarsáidí go léir leis an Roinn as seo amach
Social welfare appeal hearings
Éisteachtaí Achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
Did you get a letter with a decision from the Social Welfare Appeals Office?
An bhfuair tú fógra den chinneadh i scríbhinn nó ar iarradh ort teacht chuig agallamh chun do chás a phlé?

The Appeals Officer can make a decision using the information you sent in your Notice of Appeal. However, the Appeals Officer may wish to talk with you before making a decision. In this case, you will get a letter to attend an oral hearing

D'fhéadfadh na hOifigigh Achomhairc cuireadh a thabhairt duit teacht chuig agallamh chun do chás a phlé nó d'fhéadfaidís cinneadh a dhéanamh ar d'achomharc bunaithe ar an bhfianaise atá curtha isteach agat
Did you get a letter requesting you to attend an oral hearing?
Ar chuimhnigh tú ar dháta, am agus áit an agallaimh? Ní mór teacht in am
You will get a letter asking you to attend an oral hearing if the Appeals Officer wants to ask you more about your case
Tá na hagallaimh achomharc neamhchoimhlinteach. Is í aidhm an Oifigigh Achomhairc ná éisteacht le do chás agus déanfaidh sé cinneadh cothrom
Don't worry - an oral hearing is a good opportunity for the Appeals Officer to get to know your case in more detail
Mura féidir leat teacht, ba chóir teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an oifig chomh luath agus is féidir ionas gur féidir athrú dáta a shocrú
Appeal hearings are non-confrontational
Cinntí achomharc Leasa Shóisialaigh
You will be given a decision on your case
Tabharfar cinneadh ar do chás duit
The Appeals Officer will notify you of his/her decision and the reasons for that decision in writing
Cuirfidh an t-Oifigeach Achomhairc a c(h)inneadh, agus na fáthanna atá leis an gcinneadh sin, chugat i scríbhinn
A similar letter will be sent to the Department at the same time
Cuirfear litir den chineál céanna chuig an Roinn ag an am céanna
If there has been an oral hearing, you will get the Appeals Officer's decision within three of four weeks
Má bhí agallamh ann, gheobhaidh tú cinneadh an Oifigigh Achomhairc laistigh de trí nó ceithre mhí
The Appeals Officer will decide on the appeal and tell you of the decision in writing
Tabharfaidh an tOifigeach Achomhairc breith ar d'achomharc agus cuirfidh sé an bhreith sin in iúl chugat i scríbhinn
A similar letter will be sent to the Department at the same time
Cuirfear litir den chineál céanna chuig an Roinn ag an am céanna
If your appeal is not successful the Appeals Officer will explain why
Má theipeann ar d'achomharc, míneoidh Oifigeach na nAchomharc cén fáth
In either case you should submit a written statement of the grounds on which a review is sought
Seo roinnt ceisteanna a chuirtear go minic maidir le hachomharc a dhéanamh
